intro: Lotea ornithopodioides, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs. Lotea ornithopodioides is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
